info.title: IA-Connect Session
info.description: IA-Connect is a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) platform which adds RPA functionality from the Cloud to on-premises virtual machines or over Citrix or Microsoft Remote Desktop (RDS) connections. This is the module for automating the environment, session, file management and configuring IA-Connect.

post.description: Launch a process, command or application.

ProcessName.title: Process name
ProcessName.description: The process to run. e.g. notepad.exe or C:\windows\system32\notepad.exe.

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Any command-line arguments to use when starting the application.

WorkingDirectory.title: Working Folder
WorkingDirectory.description: The working folder/directory for the process.

UseShellExecute.title: Use Shell execute
UseShellExecute.description: Should the process be started by using the operating system shell?

CreateNoWindow.title: Create no window
CreateNoWindow.description: Should the process be started with no window?

WindowStyle.title: Window style
WindowStyle.description: Provide the window style (normal, maximised, minimised or hidden).

WaitForProcess.title: Wait for process
WaitForProcess.description: Should we wait for the process to finish? This would likely only be used when running a program or script that needed to finish before we can continue.

RedirectStandardOutput.title: Redirect standard output
RedirectStandardOutput.description: Should the standard output be redirected?

RedirectStandardError.title: Redirect standard error
RedirectStandardError.description: Should the standard error be redirected?

RedirectStandardErrorToOutput.title: Redirect standard error to output
RedirectStandardErrorToOutput.description: Should standard error be redirected to output?

StandardOutputEncoding.title: Standard output encoding
StandardOutputEncoding.description: Provide the standard output encoding (UTF8, UTF7, UTF16, ASCII or UTF16BE).

StandardErrorEncoding.title: Standard error encoding
StandardErrorEncoding.description: Provide the standard error encoding (UTF8, UTF7, UTF16, ASCII or UTF16BE).

RunAsDomain.title: RunAs Domain name
RunAsDomain.description: The domain of the run as user. If domain is not specified then the username should be in the format username@domainFQDN.

RunAsUsername.title: RunAs Username
RunAsUsername.description: The username of the run as user.

RunAsPassword.title: RunAs Password
RunAsPassword.description: The password of the run as user.

RunAsLoadUserProfile.title: RunAs load user profile
RunAsLoadUserProfile.description: Should the Windows user profile of the run as user be loaded?

TimeoutInSeconds.title: Timeout in seconds
TimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the process to finish.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ProcessStarted.title: Process started
ProcessStarted.description: Returns true if the process was started.

ProcessTimedOut.description: Returns true if the process has timed out.

ProcessId.title: Process Id
ProcessId.description: The process ID of the process that was started.

EndYCoord.description: The end Y coordinate value (in pixels).

NumberOfSteps.description: The number of steps that the drag action should be broken into.

TotalTimeInSeconds.title: Total time in seconds
TotalTimeInSeconds.description: The total time that the drag action should take from start to finish.

MaximumMovementPixelJitter.title: Maximum movement pixel jitter
MaximumMovementPixelJitter.description: The maximum pixel jitter whilst performing the drag action. The higher the value, the less 'smooth' the drag action will appear.

MaximumEndPixelJitter.title: Maximum end pixel jitter
MaximumEndPixelJitter.description: The maximum pixel jitter at the end of the drag action. The higher the value, the less precise the drag will be when reaching the end coordinate.

ProcessId.title: Process Id
ProcessId.description: The process ID of the process to retrieve the command line properties from.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ProcessCommandLine.title: Process command line
ProcessCommandLine.description: The command line properties for the process.

ProcessArguments.title: Process arguments
ProcessArguments.description: The arguments that were used when starting the process.

ProcessImagePathName.title: Process image path name
ProcessImagePathName.description: The path to the executable which started the process.

post.description: Gets the time since the last user input was received in the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Workflow.title: Workflow

LastInputTotalSeconds.title: Last input total seconds
LastInputTotalSeconds.description: The number of seconds that have elapsed since the last input.

LastInputTotalMinutes.title: Last input total minutes

LastInputTotalHours.title: Last input total hours
LastInputTotalHours.description: The number of hours that have elapsed since the last input.

post.description: Keeps the IA-Connect Agent user session alive by moving the mouse at the specified interval to prevent the session from becoming idle.

XWiggle.title: X wiggle
XWiggle.description: The number of pixels to move the mouse horizontally.

YWiggle.title: Y wiggle
YWiggle.description: The number of pixels to move the mouse vertically.

WiggleDelayInSeconds.title: Wiggle delay in seconds
WiggleDelayInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between the mouse movements when wiggling.

IdleThresholdInSeconds.title: Idle threshold in seconds
IdleThresholdInSeconds.description: The number of seconds that should have elapsed since the last input before moving the mouse.

IdleCheckPeriodInSeconds.title: Idle check period in seconds
IdleCheckPeriodInSeconds.description: The number of seconds between checking the last input time (to check if the idle threshold has been passed).

TotalKeepaliveRuntimeInSeconds.title: Total keepalive runtime in seconds
TotalKeepaliveRuntimeInSeconds.description: The total number of seconds to keep the session alive for.

Workflow.title: Workflow

KeepSessionAliveResult.title: Command result
KeepSessionAliveResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message

ErrorMessage.title: Error message

Filepath.title: File name
Filepath.description: The file path to the local file to be copied to the clipboard.

Cut.title: Cut
Cut.description: If set to true then the file will be cut instead of copied.

CopyFileToClipboardResult.title: Command result

post.description: Returns information about the IA-Connect Agent user session.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

SessionId.title: Session Id
SessionId.description: The current remote user session Id.

SessionType.title: Session type
SessionType.description: The type of remote session, either 1 (Citrix), 2 (RDP) or 0 (Console).

SessionTypeName.title: Session type name
SessionTypeName.description: The type of remote session, either ICA (Citrix), RDP or Console.

post.description: Generates a password containing dictionary words, numbers, symbols, characters as defined in a template format.

PasswordFormat.title: Password format
PasswordFormat.description: The format of the generated password. The symbol 'w' represents a dictionary word, 'n' represents a number, 's' represents a symbol, 'l' represents a lower-case letter, 'L' represents an upper-case letter. For example wnnws might generate Pluto35Marmite!

MinimumLength.title: Minimum length
MinimumLength.description: The minimum length of the generated password. If the generated password is too short, additional dictionary words will be added until the length is met.

ReturnAsPlainText.title: Return as plain text
ReturnAsPlainText.description: Set to true to return the password as plain text.

StorePasswordAsIdentifier.title: Store password as identifier
StorePasswordAsIdentifier.description: If an identifier is supplied, this password will be stored encrypted inside the Agent for later retrieval / usage by any commands which can make use of stored credentials. These passwords are only stored in memory and are lost when the Agent is closed. For example: MyExchangePassword.

SupportedSymbols.title: Supported symbols
SupportedSymbols.description: Allows you to provide a list of symbols to be randomly used when the symbol 's' is used in the format of a generated password. If not specifed, a built-in list is used. For example: !$()*.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PlainTextPassword.title: Plain text password
PlainTextPassword.description: The password in plain text if requested. The password might be requested in plain text because the password is a one-time password intended to be transmitted via SMS or email (for example) and hence needs to be seen as-is.

post.description: Retrieves a previously generated or stored password.

PasswordIdentifier.title: Password identifier
PasswordIdentifier.description: The identifier of the stored password. These passwords are only stored in memory and are lost when the Agent is closed. For example: MyExchangePassword.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

PlainTextPassword.title: Plain text password
PlainTextPassword.description: The password in plain text. The password might be needed in plain text if the password is a one-time password intended to be transmitted via SMS or email (for example) and hence needs to be seen as-is.

post.description: Accepts an input string which contains references to IA-Connect stored passwords and returns that string with the references replaced by the stored passwords.

InputString.title: Input string
InputString.description: The input string which contains IA-Connect stored password identifiers. For example: 'Welcome new starter, your new account password is {IAConnectPassword:GeneratedPassword}' where 'GeneratedPassword' is the name of a stored IA-Connect password.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

OutputString.title: Output string
OutputString.description: The output string which contains the input string with password identifiers replaced by the actual passwords. For example: 'Welcome new starter, your new account password is Fantastic12Monkeys!'.

post.description: Writes a username and password to a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session, creating that credential if it doesn't exist. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel.

CredentialAddress.title: Credential address
CredentialAddress.description: The name / address of the credential.

CredentialType.title: Credential type
CredentialType.description: The credential type: Windows or Generic.

CredentialPersistence.title: Credential persistence
CredentialPersistence.description: The credential persistence: Session (lasts just for this login session), LocalMachine (persists for this user across sessions and reboots on this computer only) or Enterprise (could roam for this across between machines).

SymmetricKey.title: Symmetric encryption key
SymmetricKey.description: An optional symmetric encryption key used to encrypt the credential. You can only retrieve this credential if you know the key. Only usable with Generic Credentials.

StorePasswordAsIdentifier.title: Store password as identifier
StorePasswordAsIdentifier.description: If an identifier is supplied, this password will also be stored encrypted inside the Agent for later retrieval / usage by any commands which can make use of stored credentials. These passwords are only stored in memory and are lost when the Agent is closed. For example: MyExchangePassword.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

CredentialWriteResult.title: Command result
CredentialWriteResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Reads a username and password from a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel. Both the username and password can be retrieved from a Generic credential while only the username can be retrieved from a Windows credential.

CredentialAddress.title: Credential address
CredentialAddress.description: The name / address of the credential.

CredentialType.title: Credential type
CredentialType.description: The credential type: Windows or Generic.

SymmetricKey.title: Symmetric encryption key
SymmetricKey.description: An optional symmetric encryption key used to decrypt the credential password (use if the credential was encrypted with a key). Only usable with Generic Credentials since the password for a Windows credential cannot be retrieved.

StorePasswordAsIdentifier.title: Store password as identifier
StorePasswordAsIdentifier.description: If an identifier is supplied, the retrieved credential password will be stored encrypted inside the Agent for later retrieval / usage by any commands which can make use of stored credentials. These passwords are only stored in memory and are lost when the Agent is closed. Only usable with Generic Credentials since the password for a Windows credential cannot be retrieved. For example: MyExchangePassword.

DontReturnPassword.title: Dont return password
DontReturnPassword.description: If set to true, the credential password won't be returned. This is useful if you are storing the password within the Agent for use by further commands (i.e. 'Store password as identifier' is true), but you don't actually need to know the password within your workflow.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Deletes a credential in the user's profile in the IA-Connect Agent session. Credentials can be viewed from the Windows Control Panel.

CredentialAddress.title: Credential address
CredentialAddress.description: The name / address of the credential.

CredentialType.title: Credential type
CredentialType.description: The credential type: Windows or Generic.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

CredentialDeleteResult.title: Command result
CredentialDeleteResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.summary: Create Remote Desktop Session (RDS) launch file
post.description: Create a Remote Desktop Session (RDS) launch file which can be used to automatically launch a Remote Desktop Session using specified parameters, instead of requiring automation of the Remote Desktop client UI. A RDS launch file has the extension '.rdp' and is often called a RDP file.

RemoteAddress.title: Remote address
RemoteAddress.description: The address of the remote system to connect to. This could be an IP address, hostname or Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN).

OutputFolderPath.title: Output folder path
OutputFolderPath.description: The folder in which to save the RDP file.

RDPFileName.title: RDP filename
RDPFileName.description: The name of the RDP file which will be created in the output folder path.

OverwriteRDPFileIfAlreadyExists.title: Overwrite RDP file if already exists
OverwriteRDPFileIfAlreadyExists.description: Set to true to automatically overwrite any RDP file with the same folder / filename. Set to false if a new RDP file should not be created if an existing RDP file with the same folder / filename already exists.

TrustRemoteComputer.title: Trust remote computer
TrustRemoteComputer.description: Set to true to mark the remote address as trusted (in the Windows registry), mainly for device redirection purposes, eliminating a popup you might receive when launching the RDP file.

StoreCredentials.title: Store credentials
StoreCredentials.description: Set to true to create a user credential to hold the Remote Desktop authentication details. This can allow you to connect to the Remote Desktop system without being prompted for authentication.

UserName.title: UserName
UserName.description: If storing a credential to hold the Remote Desktop authentication details, this allows you to specify the username to store in the credential.

Password.title: Password
Password.description: If storing a credential to hold the Remote Desktop authentication details, this allows you to specify the password to store in the credential.

CredentialType.title: Credential type
CredentialType.description: If storing a credential to hold the Remote Desktop authentication details, the allows you to specify the credential type: Windows or Generic. For saving a RDP credential, you would typically create a Windows credential.

CredentialPersistence.title: Credential persistence
CredentialPersistence.description: If storing a credential to hold the Remote Desktop authentication details, this alows you to specify the credential persistence: Session (lasts just for this login session), LocalMachine (persists for this user across sessions and reboots on this computer only) or Enterprise (could roam for this across between machines). The default when creating RDP files is 'Session'.

RedirectPrinters.title: Redirect printers
RedirectPrinters.description: Should printers in the local session be mapped into the remote desktop session? This setting might be enforced at the remote end and hence not take effect.

RedirectAllDrives.title: Redirect all drives
RedirectAllDrives.description: Should all drive letters (e.g. C:) in the local session be mapped into the remote desktop session? This setting might be enforced at the remote end and hence not take effect.

RedirectClipboard.title: Redirect clipboard
RedirectClipboard.description: Should the clipboard be shared between the local and remote system, allowing copy and paste between the two systems? This setting might be enforced at the remote end and hence not take effect.

Fullscreen.title: Fullscreen
Fullscreen.description: Should the remote desktop session be fullscreen.

DesktopWidth.title: Desktop width
DesktopWidth.description: The width of the remote desktop session in pixels if the remote desktop session is not fullscreen.

DesktopHeight.title: Desktop height
DesktopHeight.description: The height of the remote desktop session in pixels if the remote desktop session is not fullscreen.

UseMultiMonitor.title: Use multi monitor
UseMultiMonitor.description: Set to false if a fullscreen remote desktop session should only use a single monitor. Set to true if a fullscreen remote desktop session should use all monitors. Has no effect on a single-monitor system (and hence most virtual machines).

SessionBPP.title: Session colour depth
SessionBPP.description: The colour depth of the remote desktop session in bits per pixel (BPP). A higher number results in more colours. Supported values are 15, 16, 24, 32.

SmartSizing.title: Smart sizing
SmartSizing.description: Set to true for the local computer to automatically scale the contents of the remote session to fit the windows size. Set to false to not automatically scale.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

RDPFilePath.title: RDP file path
RDPFilePath.description: The full path of the generated RDP file.

post.description: Launch a Remote Desktop Session (RDS) using a RDP launch file.

RDPFilePath.title: RDP file path
RDPFilePath.description: The full path to a RDP file (which could either pre-exist or be created using the action: 'Create Remote Desktop Session (RDS) launch file').

TrustRemoteComputer.title: Trust remote computer
TrustRemoteComputer.description: Set to true to mark the remote address (set in the RDP file) as trusted (in the Windows registry), mainly for device redirection purposes, eliminating a popup you might receive when launching the RDP file.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

LaunchRemoteDesktopSessionResult.title: Command result
LaunchRemoteDesktopSessionResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Reports whether a network TCP port is responding to a connection attempt by the IA-Connect Agent. This could be a TCP port on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running (enter 'localhost' for the remote host) or on any remote computer. If the IA-Connect Agent successfully connects to a TCP port, it immediately closes the TCP connection.

RemoteHost.title: Remote host
RemoteHost.description: The IPv4 address, DNS address or hostname of the computer to connect to. Enter 'localhost' to check a TCP port on the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running. Examples: 192.168.1.10 or www.test.com or vm-server19.

TCPPort.title: TCP port
TCPPort.description: The TCP port number to connect to on the specified remote (or local) host. A TCP port must be 1 or higher and 65535 or lower. Examples of common well-known ports are 80 (HTTP), 443 (HTTPS), 445 (SMB / file sharing).

TimeoutInSeconds.title: Timeout in seconds
TimeoutInSeconds.description: The maximum number of seconds to wait for the TCP connection. This defaults to 10 seconds but most working connections would be expected to connect within a few seconds (over the Internet) or less than a second (local network).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

TCPPortConnected.title: TCP port connected
TCPPortConnected.description: Set to true if the TCP port connected or false if the TCP port failed to connect.

ConnectionErrorMessage.title: Connection error message
ConnectionErrorMessage.description: The error message if the TCP port failed to connect. This will commonly be a DNS / name lookup error or a timeout.

post.description: Add a new Orchestrator automation task into a queue that can be monitored from a Flow. Tasks can either be ready to run immediately or be deferred to run at a later time.

SetAutomationName.title: Set automation name
SetAutomationName.description: Select 'Auto' if you want to use the flow name as the task name or select 'Manual' and enter a name in 'Automation name' field to use that name.

x-ms-enum-values.displayName: Auto: Use name of the flow
Manual: Set your own automation task name

AutomationName.title: Automation name
AutomationName.description: This will only be used if 'Manual' is chosen in the 'Set automation name' field. A friendly name given to help identify the task later or to associate it with a particular flow. Multiple tasks can use the same automation name.

TaskInputData.title: Task input data
TaskInputData.description: Optional data to make available to the task when it starts. You are free to store data in any format, but JSON is a commonly used format.

ProcessStage.title: Process stage
ProcessStage.description: The point at where the automation process / flow should start. This is an optional string value which will be unique to the specific process / flow. This will be used by a condition within the process / flow to decide what step to perform next. For example: If you want the process / flow to start at the 'Exchange' stage, enter the value 'Exchange'.

Priority.title: Priority
Priority.description: Set the priority level of this automation task (1 being highest level).

SLA.title: SLA in minutes
SLA.description: Set the amount of minutes required for your SLA. Set this to 0 if you don't have an SLA. By default automation tasks close to the end of the SLA will take priority over other tasks.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the Orchestrator automation task that was created.

post.description: Add a new Orchestrator deferred task into a queue that can be monitored from a Flow. The task will be deferred to a specified time in the future. Use this action to temporarily suspend a task for a specified amount of time (for example if you are waiting for something).

SetAutomationName.title: Set automation name
SetAutomationName.description: Select 'Auto' if you want to use the flow name as the task name or select 'Manual' and enter a name in 'Automation name' field to use that name.

x-ms-enum-values.displayName: Auto: Use name of the flow
Manual: Set your own automation task name

AutomationName.title: Automation name
AutomationName.description: This will only be used if 'Manual' is chosen in the 'Set automation name' field. A friendly name given to help identify the task later or to associate it with a particular flow. Multiple tasks can use the same automation name.

DeferralTimeInMinutes.title: Deferral time in minutes
DeferralTimeInMinutes.description: How many minutes should the automation task be delayed for.

DeferralStoredData.title: Deferral stored data
DeferralStoredData.description: Optional data to store with this task. It will become available to the process / flow when it continues from a deferral. This is generally used to store data you have calculated during your process / flow that you need to become available again after deferral. You are free to store data in any format, but JSON is a commonly used format.

ProcessStage.title: Process stage
ProcessStage.description: The point at where the automation process / flow should continue after deferral. This is an optional string value which will be unique to the specific process / flow. This will be used by a condition within the deferred process / flow to decide what step to perform next. For example: If you want the process / flow to continue at the 'Exchange' stage when it continues after deferral, enter the value 'Exchange'.

Priority.title: Priority
Priority.description: Set the priority level of this task (1 being highest level).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the deferral task that was created.

post.description: Defer an existing Orchestrator task which is already in the queue. The task will be deferred to a specified time in the future. This is commonly used to re-defer an existing task (i.e. the task was previously deferred and now needs to be deferred again). Use this action to temporarily suspend a task for a specified amount of time (for example if you are waiting for something).

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the existing Orchestrator automation task to defer (or defer again).

DeferralTimeInMinutes.title: Deferral time in minutes
DeferralTimeInMinutes.description: How many minutes should the automation task be delayed for.

DeferralStoredData.title: Deferral stored data
DeferralStoredData.description: Optional data to store with this task. It will become available to the process / flow when it continues from a deferral. This is generally used to store data you have calculated during your process / flow that you need to become available again after deferral. You are free to store data in any format, but JSON is a commonly used format.

ProcessStage.title: Process stage
ProcessStage.description: The point at where the automation process / flow should continue after deferral. This is an optional string value which will be unique to the specific process / flow. This will be used by a condition within the deferred process / flow to decide what step to perform next. For example: If you want the process / flow to continue at the 'Exchange' stage when it continues after deferral, enter the value 'Exchange'.

Priority.title: Priority
Priority.description: Set the priority level of this task (1 being highest level).

TasksDeferExistingTaskResult.title: Command result
TasksDeferExistingTaskResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Delete an Orchestrator automation task that has been deferred.

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the Orchestrator automation task to delete.

TasksDeleteTaskResult.title: Command result
TasksDeleteTaskResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Retrieves all the Orchestrator automation tasks that match the filters.

AutomationName.title: Automation name filter
AutomationName.description: Leave blank to return Orchestrator automation tasks with any name. Enter a value to only retrieve tasks with this automation name.

AutomationTaskStatus.title: Automation task status filter
AutomationTaskStatus.description: Filter the automation by the specified automation task status. Leave the field blank to return all automation task statuses.

MinutesUntilDeferralDate.title: Minutes until deferral date
MinutesUntilDeferralDate.description: Only return Orchestrator automation tasks that are ready to run within the specified number of minutes. Set to 0 if you only want automation tasks that are ready to run now. Leave blank if you want to retrieve tasks regardless of deferral.

MinimumPriorityLevel.title: Minimum priority level
MinimumPriorityLevel.description: Only return Orchestrator automation tasks that have the specifed priority level or higher. For example: Setting 2 will return tasks with a priority level of 1 and 2.

SortByDeferralDate.title: Sort by deferral date
SortByDeferralDate.description: Set to true to return the data sorted by the deferral date and time. Set to false to have the data returned in the order is it stored.

AutomationTasks.title: Automation Tasks
AutomationTasks.description: A table containing all the Orchestrator automation tasks that meet the given search criteria.

NumberOfAutomationTasks.title: Number of automation tasks
NumberOfAutomationTasks.description: The number of automation tasks returned.

post.description: Retrieves a specfic Orchestrator automation task.

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the Orchestrator task you want to retrieve.

AutomationName.title: Automation name
AutomationName.description: The name of the retrieved Orchestrator task.

DeferralDateTime.title: Deferral date and time
DeferralDateTime.description: The date and time when the retrieved Orchestrator task is scheduled to be ready. This will be returned as a string in UTC.

DeferralStoredData.title: Deferral stored data
DeferralStoredData.description: Optional data that was stored when the task was deferred. This is usually data that you need to continue the process / flow.

DeferralCount.title: Deferral count
DeferralCount.description: How often this task was deferred. This will typically be 0 for a new task which was never deferred or 1 or more for a deferred task. Each time a deferred task was deferred again, the Orchestrator will automatically increase this number.

TaskInputData.title: Task input data
TaskInputData.description: Optional data that was stored when the task was created. This is usually data that was used to start the process / flow, but you can use this field for any purpose.

Priority.title: Priority
Priority.description: The priority level of this Orchestrator task (1 being highest level).

AutomationTaskStatus.title: Automation task status
AutomationTaskStatus.description: The status of the retrieved Orchestrator task.

ProcessStage.title: Process stage
ProcessStage.description: The point at where the automation process / flow should continue after deferral. This is an optional string value which will be unique to the specific process / flow. This will be used by a condition within the deferred process / flow to decide what step to perform next. For example: If you want the process / flow to continue at the 'Exchange' stage when it continues after deferral, enter the value 'Exchange'.

ReceivedDateTime.title: Received date and time
ReceivedDateTime.description: The date and time the task was initially received by the Orchestrator. This will be returned as a string in UTC.

MinutesUntilDeferralDate.title: Minutes until deferral date
MinutesUntilDeferralDate.description: The number of minutes until this task's deferral date (ie. when this task is ready to run). If this task is ready to run the minutes will be 0.

OnHold.title: On hold
OnHold.description: Is set to true if the task is on hold. An old hold task will never be retrieved by the 'Get next Orchestrator automation task' action and hence will never be processed in a normal workflow.

post.description: Retrieves the next Orchestrator automation task matching the given search critieria.

AutomationName.title: Automation name
AutomationName.description: Leave blank to return Orchestrator automation tasks with any name. Enter a value to only retrieve tasks with this automation name.

MinimumPriorityLevel.title: Minimum priority level
MinimumPriorityLevel.description: Only return Orchestrator automation tasks that have the specifed priority level or higher. For example: Setting 2 will return tasks with a priority level of 1 and 2.

StatusChange.title: Change status to
StatusChange.description: If set to 'Retrieved': When retrieving a task the task status will change to 'Retrieved' to prevent other actions from trying to run the same task. If set to 'Do nothing' the task status will not be changed.

MinutesUntilDeferralDate.title: Minutes until deferral date
MinutesUntilDeferralDate.description: Only return Orchestrator automation tasks that are ready to run within the specified number of minutes. Set to 0 if you only want automation tasks that are ready to run now.

IgnoreSLA.title: Ignore SLA
IgnoreSLA.description: Set this to true to ignore any SLAs that have been set on the task. By default a task with an SLA that will soon breach takes priority over everything else.

TaskRetrieved.title: Task retrieved
TaskRetrieved.description: Set to true if a task was retrieved. Set to false if there were no tasks matching the search critieria.

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The id of the retrieved Orchestrator automation task.

AutomationNameOutput.title: Automation name
AutomationNameOutput.description: The name of the retrieved automation task.

DeferralDateTime.title: Deferral date and time
DeferralDateTime.description: The date and time when the retrieved Orchestrator task is scheduled to be ready. This will be returned as a string in UTC.

DeferralStoredData.title: Deferral stored data
DeferralStoredData.description: Optional data that was stored when the task was deferred. This is usually data that you need to continue the process / flow, but you can use this field for any purpose.

DeferralCount.title: Deferral count
DeferralCount.description: How often this task was deferred. This will typically be 0 for a new task which was never deferred or 1 or more for a deferred task. Each time a deferred task was deferred again, the Orchestrator will automatically increase this number.

TaskInputData.title: Task input data
TaskInputData.description: Optional data that was stored when the task was created. This is usually data that was used to start the process / flow, but you can use this field for any purpose.

Priority.title: Priority
Priority.description: The priority level of this Orchestrator task (1 being highest level).

AutomationTaskStatus.title: Automation task status
AutomationTaskStatus.description: The status of the retrieved Orchestrator task.

ProcessStage.title: Process stage
ProcessStage.description: The point at which the deferred process / flow should continue after deferral. This is an optional string value which will be unique to the specific process / flow. This will be used by a condition within the deferred process / flow to decide what step to perform next.

ReceivedDateTime.title: Received date and time
ReceivedDateTime.description: The date and time the task was initially received by the Orchestrator. This will be returned as a string in UTC.

MinutesUntilDeferralDateOutput.title: Minutes until deferral date
MinutesUntilDeferralDateOutput.description: The number of minutes until this task's deferral date (ie. when this task is ready to run). If this task is ready to run the minutes will be 0.

post.description: Changes the selected Orchestrator automation task status to completed, failed or new.

TaskId.title: Task Id
TaskId.description: The Id of the Orchestrator task to be modified.

AutomationTaskStatus.title: Automation task new status
AutomationTaskStatus.description: The new task status for the specified automation task.

TaskOnHold.title: Put task on hold
TaskOnHold.description: If changing the status to new and you set this value to true, the task will be put on hold.

EraseTaskInputData.title: Erase task input data

LocalFilename.title: Local filename
LocalFilename.description: The full path to the alternative IA-Connect Agent.exe that is accessible from the IA-Connect director.

RemoteFilename.title: Remote filename
RemoteFilename.description: The full path to the location to copy the alternative IA-Connect Agent.exe (on the remote system). If not specified, a temporary filename will be chosen. If the alternative IA-Connect Agent is being loaded into memory then this file won't be created (since it's not needed) unless you set 'Save to disk even if running from memory' to true. You would only set this to true if you wanted to use IA-Connect's Dynamic Code actions which required 'Reference executing assembly' (e.g. to access IA-Connect internal methods).

Compress.title: Compress
Compress.description: Should the alternative IA-Connect Agent executable be compressed during the upload?

Arguments.title: Arguments
Arguments.description: Any optional arguments to pass to the IA-Connect Agent.exe when it runs.

PermitDowngrade.title: Permit downgrade
PermitDowngrade.description: Should earlier versions of IA-Connect Agent be allowed?

SkipVersionCheck.title: Skip version check
SkipVersionCheck.description: Should the version of the IA-Connect Agents (existing and new) not be checked at all, resulting in the new version being used in all scenarios (even same version)?

LoadIntoMemory.title: Load into memory
LoadIntoMemory.description: Should the alternative IA-Connect Agent be ran in memory? If set to true, the new Agent is loaded into memory and executed within an Assembly of the existing Agent. If set to false, the new Agent is executed as a normal process and the existing Agent EXE will exit.

SaveToDiskEvenIfRunningFromMemory.title: Save to disk even if running from memory
SaveToDiskEvenIfRunningFromMemory.description: Should the alternative IA-Connect Agent be saved to disk even if it is being ran in memory? You would only set this to true if you wanted to use IA-Connect's Dynamic Code actions which required 'Reference executing assembly' (e.g. to access IA-Connect internal methods).

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Enables the next hop which will forward all future commands received onto the IA-Connect Agent running in the next hop session.

NextHopDirectorAddress.title: Next hop Director address
NextHopDirectorAddress.description: The optional address for the Next hop IA-Connect Director to forward commands to if none of the 'Next hop Director address is localhost', 'Next hop Director address is hostname', 'Next hop Director address is FQDN' or 'Next hop Director address is named pipe' parameters are set to true.

NextHopDirectorTCPPort.title: Next hop Director TCP port
NextHopDirectorTCPPort.description: The TCP port that the next hop Director is listening on (the Director on the computer that the Agent is running on).

NextHopDirectorUsesHTTPS.title: Next hop Director uses HTTPS
NextHopDirectorUsesHTTPS.description: Set to True if the next hop Director is using HTTPS, or false if not.

NextHopDirectorAddressIsLocalhostname.title: Next hop Director address is localhost
NextHopDirectorAddressIsLocalhostname.description: The next hop director address (relative to the Agent) is 'localhost'.

NextHopDirectorAddressIsHostname.title: Next hop Director address is hostname
NextHopDirectorAddressIsHostname.description: The next hop director address is the hostname of the computer running the Agent (i.e. the one running the Agent and the Director).

NextHopDirectorAddressIsFQDN.title: Next hop Director address is FQDN
NextHopDirectorAddressIsFQDN.description: The next hop director address is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the computer running the Agent (i.e. the one running the Agent and the Director).

NextHopDirectorAddressIsNamedPipe.title: Next hop Director address is named pipe
NextHopDirectorAddressIsNamedPipe.description: The next hop director address (relative to the Agent) is using a named pipe instead of a TCP/IP web service. This is the default to avoid using TCP/IP ports on the first-hop.

IncrementNextHopDirectorTCPPortBySession.title: Increment next hop Director TCP port by Session Id
IncrementNextHopDirectorTCPPortBySession.description: To ensure the next hop Director TCP port is unique (if there are multiple parallel sessions using next-hop from the same host), the Session Id can be added to the Next hop Director TCP port.

DisableBeforeEnable.title: Disable before enabling
DisableBeforeEnable.description: Should double-hop be disabled (if currently active) before enabling again? If set to true (the default), any new double-hop enablement instructions will replace the previous ones. If set to false, this will enable triple-hop since the instructions will be received by the double-hop IA-Connect Agent.

CheckNextHopDirectorIsRunning.title: Check next hop Director is running
CheckNextHopDirectorIsRunning.description: Next hop requires a running IA-Connect Director on the same computer as the Agent. If this setting is true, the Agent will check the next-hop Director is running as described and will fail to enable next hop if the next hop Director is not running. If this setting is false, the Agent will not perform any checks and simply enable next-hop.

CheckNextHopAgentIsRunning.title: Check next hop Agent is running
CheckNextHopAgentIsRunning.description: Next hop requires a running IA-Connect Director on the same computer as the Agent AND a running IA-Connect Agent in the next-hop session. If this setting is true, the Agent will check the next-hop Agent is running as described and will fail to enable next hop if the next hop Agent is not running. If this setting is false, the Agent will not perform any checks and simply enable next-hop.

Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

ActiveNextHopDirectorAddress.description: The address of the active next hop Director, if one is being used.

ActiveNextHopDirectorTCPPort.title: Active next hop Director TCP port
ActiveNextHopDirectorTCPPort.description: The TCP port of the active next hop Director, if one is being used.

ActiveNextHopDirectorUsesHTTPS.title: Active next hop Director uses HTTPS
ActiveNextHopDirectorUsesHTTPS.description: Returns true if the active next hop Director is using HTTPS.

ActiveNextHopDirectorURL.title: Active next hop Director URL
ActiveNextHopDirectorURL.description: The URL of the active next hop Director.

NextHopDirectorTCPPort.title: Next hop Director TCP port
NextHopDirectorTCPPort.description: The TCP port that the next hop Director is listening on (the Director on the computer that the Agent is running on).

NextHopDirectorUsesHTTPS.title: Next hop Director uses HTTPS

NextHopDirectorAddressIsLocalhostname.title: Next hop Director address is localhost

NextHopDirectorAddressIsHostname.title: Next hop Director address is hostname
NextHopDirectorAddressIsHostname.description: The next hop director address is the hostname of the computer running the Agent (i.e. the one running the Agent and the Director).

NextHopDirectorAddressIsFQDN.title: Next hop Director address is FQDN
NextHopDirectorAddressIsFQDN.description: The next hop director address is the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the computer running the Agent (i.e. the one running the Agent and the Director).

NextHopDirectorAddressIsNamedPipe.title: Next hop Director address is named pipe
NextHopDirectorAddressIsNamedPipe.description: The next hop director address (relative to the Agent) is using a named pipe instead of a TCP/IP web service. This is the default to avoid using TCP/IP ports on the first-hop.

IncrementNextHopDirectorTCPPortBySession.title: Increment next hop Director TCP port by Session Id
IncrementNextHopDirectorTCPPortBySession.description: To ensure the next hop Director TCP port is unique (if there are multiple parallel sessions using next-hop from the same host), the Session Id can be added to the Next hop Director TCP port.

post.description: Configure the next-hop Director in a double-hop scenario. This is only required if the default IA-Connect next-hop Director settings are not suitable.

SOAPEnabled.title: SOAP enabled
SOAPEnabled.description: Should the SOAP interface be enabled on the next-hop Director?

RESTEnabled.title: REST enabled
RESTEnabled.description: Should the REST interface be enabled on the next-hop Director?

WebServerEnabled.title: Web server enabled
WebServerEnabled.description: Should the web server (for hosting the IA-Connect Inspector) be enabled on the next-hop Director?

DirectorIsLocalhostOnly.title: Director is localhost only
DirectorIsLocalhostOnly.description: Should the Director SOAP and REST interfaces only listen on 'localhost'? This should be set to true since no other computer should need to communicate with these interfaces.

SOAPTCPPort.title: SOAP TCP port
SOAPTCPPort.description: If the SOAP interface were enabled, what TCP port should it run on (defaults to 8002)?

RESTTCPPort.title: REST TCP port
RESTTCPPort.description: If the REST interface were enabled, what TCP port should it run on (defaults to 8002)?

SOAPUsesHTTPS.title: SOAP uses HTTPS
SOAPUsesHTTPS.description: Is the SOAP interface using HTTPS (instead of HTTP)? If set to True then a certificate is required on the first-hop computer to facilitate HTTPS. This can be shared with the certificate used for REST.

RESTUsesHTTPS.title: REST uses HTTPS
RESTUsesHTTPS.description: Is the REST interface using HTTPS (instead of HTTP)? If set to True then a certificate is required on the first-hop computer to facilitate HTTPS. This can be shared with the certificate used for SOAP.

IncrementDirectorTCPPortBySessionId.title: Increment Director TCP port by SessionId
IncrementDirectorTCPPortBySessionId.description: To ensure the Director TCP port is unique (if there are multiple parallel sessions using double-hop from the same first-hop host), the first-hop Session Id can be added to the Director TCP port. This is only required if either SOAP or REST is enabled on the first-hop Director and these are typically not enabled because named pipes are used by default.

SOAPUsesUserAuthentication.title: SOAP uses user authentication
SOAPUsesUserAuthentication.description: Set to True if you want the HTTP SOAP TCP port to use user authentication. Refer to the IA-Connect Installation Guide for information on how to set this up.

RESTUsesUserAuthentication.title: REST uses user authentication
RESTUsesUserAuthentication.description: Set to True if you want the HTTP REST TCP port to use user authentication. Refer to the IA-Connect Installation Guide for information on how to set this up.

CommandNamedPipeEnabled.title: Command named pipe enabled
CommandNamedPipeEnabled.description: Should the first-hop Agent use named pipes to communicate with the first-hop Director? This is the default communication method.

This is used to modify the final result of a Flow stat in the IA-Connect Orchestator which is typically used for reporting purposes. This only works for the current Flow (the Orchestrator detects the Flow run Id). You cannot modify the stats for any other Flow.

FlowLastActionSuccess.title: Flow last action success
FlowLastActionSuccess.description: Set to true to specify that the last action in an Orchestrator Flow stat is a success. Set to false to specify that the last action in an Orchestrator Flow stat is a failure. Leave this field blank if you don't want to update the flow last action status (for example: If you only wish to update the last action code.

FlowLastActionErrorMessage.title: Flow last action error message
FlowLastActionErrorMessage.description: If specifying that the Flow last action was a failure, provide an error message here.

FlowLastActionCode.title: Flow last action code
FlowLastActionCode.description: An optional code to assign to the Flow stat. This is typically used as an error code (for example, to distinguish between System and Business exceptions), but could be used as a success code.

UpdateOrchestratorFlowStatsResultResult.title: Command result
UpdateOrchestratorFlowStatsResultResult.description: The result of the command (success or failure).

ErrorMessage.title: Error message
ErrorMessage.description: If the command was not successful, this will contain the error message that was returned.

post.description: Returns a list of Flow stats from the IA-Connect Orchestrator. Used for reporting purposes. You can optionally use one or more filters to limit the returned results.

WithinLastNumberOfDays.title: Within last number of days
WithinLastNumberOfDays.description: Filter results to retrieve only those started within the last specified number of days. Set to 0 to not filter.

SearchFlowName.title: Flow name
SearchFlowName.description: Filter results to retrieve only those with the specified Flow name. Set to blank to not filter by flow name.

SearchFlowLastActionResult.title: Flow last action result
SearchFlowLastActionResult.description: Filter results to retrieve only those with the specified last action result. Set to true to only retrieve successful Flows. Set to false to only retrieve failed Flows. Don't set a value / set to blank to not filter by Flow last action result.

SearchFlowStartTimeStartWindow.title: Flow start time start window
SearchFlowStartTimeStartWindow.description: Filter results to retrieve only those which started after the specified start time. Set to blank to not filter. For example: '2022-01-24T07:00:00' would return all Orchestrator Flow stats for Flows that started on or after 07.00 hours on the 24th of January 2022. All datetimes are in UTC (GMT+0) so you may wish to use the Convert DateTime action to convert your local time to UTC.

SearchFlowStartTimeEndWindow.title: Flow start time end window
SearchFlowStartTimeEndWindow.description: Filter results to retrieve only those which started before the specified start time. Set to blank to not filter. For example: '2022-01-25T07:00:00' would return all Orchestrator Flow stats for Flows that started on or before 07.00 hours on the 25th of January 2022. All datetimes are in UTC (GMT+0) so you may wish to use the Convert DateTime action to convert your local time to UTC.

CreateNewFileIfNotExists.description: If the input file does not exist, should a new one be created?

WriteSpaceBeforeEquals.title: Write space before equals
WriteSpaceBeforeEquals.description: Should a space be written before the equals ( = ) sign?

WriteSpaceAfterEquals.title: Write space after equals
WriteSpaceAfterEquals.description: Should a space be written after the equals ( = ) sign?

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: Downloads a file to the computer where the IA-Connect Agent is running using HTTP(S).

DownloadURL.title: Download URL
DownloadURL.description: The HTTP or HTTPS download URL.

SaveFilename.title: Save file path
SaveFilename.description: The full path to the save filename. If this field is blank and you have specified 'Return contents as string' as True then the file will not be saved to the computer.

OverwriteExistingFile.title: Overwrite existing file
OverwriteExistingFile.description: If a file already exists with the name specified in the 'Save file path' input, should it be overwritten?

PassthroughAuthentication.title: Passthrough authentication
PassthroughAuthentication.description: Should the user's credentials be passed on to the web server? This would typically only be used for internal Intranet sites.

UserAgent.default: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.193 Safari/537.36
UserAgent.title: User Agent
UserAgent.description: This allows you to set the User Agent reported to the web page. Typically this is not required and should only be changed if a webpage requires a particular Agent String.

Accept.title: Accept
Accept.description: This parameter specifies which content types are supported. This should only be changed if the content you are downloading requires a different content type.

SupportTLS10.title: Support TLS10
SupportTLS10.description: Set to True to support TLS 1.0 encryption protocol.

SupportTLS11.title: Support TLS11
SupportTLS11.description: Set to True to support TLS 1.1 encryption protocol.

SupportTLS12.title: Support TLS12
SupportTLS12.description: Set to True to support TLS 1.2 encryption protocol.

AutoDecompressDeflate.title: Auto decompress deflate
AutoDecompressDeflate.description: Some web content is returned compressed using 'deflate' compression. Setting this value to True informs the web server that 'deflate' is supported and, if the content is sent using this compression, it will automatically be decompressed.

AutoDecompressGZIP.title: Auto decompress GZip
AutoDecompressGZIP.description: Some web content is returned compressed using 'GZIP' compression. Setting this value to True informs the web server that 'GZIP' is supported and, if the content is sent using this compression, it will automatically be decompressed.

ReturnContentsAsString.title: Return contents as string
ReturnContentsAsString.description: Should the file contents be returned as a string?

ReturnContentEncoding.title: Return content encoding
ReturnContentEncoding.description: The encoding of the downloaded content. This is only used if 'Return contents as string' is True and it defines the encoding of the downloaded content so it can be interpreted correctly.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

DownloadFileContents.title: Download file contents
DownloadFileContents.description: The contents of the downloaded file.

post.description: Unzips a file which has been compressed using ZIP compression.

ZIPFilename.title: ZIP file path
ZIPFilename.description: The full path to the ZIP file to be unzipped. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

ExtractFolder.title: Extract folder
ExtractFolder.description: The folder path of the folder to extract the ZIP into. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

ExtractAllFilesToSingleFolder.title: Extract all files to single folder
ExtractAllFilesToSingleFolder.description: If set to True, the folder structure inside the ZIP will be ignored and all files will be extracted to the specified folder.

IncludeFilesRegEx.title: Include files regular expression
IncludeFilesRegEx.description: An optional regular expression to allow you to specify which files should be extracted. Matches filename only.

ExcludeFilesRegEx.title: Exclude files regular expression
ExcludeFilesRegEx.description: An optional regular expression to allow you to specify which files should be excluded from extraction. Matches filename only.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

FilesExtractedSuccessfully.title: Number of files extracted successfully
FilesExtractedSuccessfully.description: The number of files that were extracted from the ZIP successfully.

FilesFailedToExtract.title: Number of files failed to extract
FilesFailedToExtract.description: The number of files that failed to extract from the ZIP.

FilesExcluded.title: Number of files excluded
FilesExcluded.description: The number of files that were excluded (if using the 'Exclude files regular expression' input).

post.description: ZIPs a file (stores the file into a compression archive).

SourceFilenameToAddToZIP.title: Source file path to add to ZIP
SourceFilenameToAddToZIP.description: The file path to the file to be added to the zip. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

OutputZIPFilename.title: Output ZIP file path
OutputZIPFilename.description: The file path that the ZIP should be output to. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

AddFilenameToFolderInZIP.title: Add filename to folder in ZIP
AddFilenameToFolderInZIP.description: If you want to add the source file to a folder in the ZIP file, enter the folder name here.

SourceFilenameToAddToZIPComment.title: Source filename to add to ZIP comment
SourceFilenameToAddToZIPComment.description: An optional comment for this file added to the ZIP.

Compress.title: Compress
Compress.description: Should the file be compressed when zipping?

AddToExistingZIPFile.title: Add to existing ZIP file
AddToExistingZIPFile.description: Set to True to add to an existing ZIP file.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

post.description: ZIPs files in a folder into a ZIP file (stores the files into a compression archive).

SourceFolderToAddToZIP.title: Source folder to add to ZIP
SourceFolderToAddToZIP.description: The path to the folder to be added to the zip. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

OutputZIPFilename.title: Output ZIP file path
OutputZIPFilename.description: The file path that the ZIP should be output to. This must be accessible from the session where the IA-Connect Agent is running.

AddFilesToFolderInZIP.title: Add files to folder in ZIP
AddFilesToFolderInZIP.description: If you want to add the source files to a folder in the ZIP file, enter the folder name here.

Compress.title: Compress
Compress.description: Should the folder be compressed when zipping?

AddToExistingZIPFile.title: Add to existing ZIP file
AddToExistingZIPFile.description: Set to True to add to an existing ZIP file.

IncludeSubfolders.title: Include subfolders
IncludeSubfolders.description: Should subfolders within the source folder also be added to the ZIP?

IncludeFilesRegEx.title: Include files regular expression
IncludeFilesRegEx.description: An optional regular expression to allow you to specify which files should be extracted. Matches filename only.

ExcludeFilesRegEx.title: Exclude files regular expression
ExcludeFilesRegEx.description: An optional regular expression to allow you to specify which files should be excluded from extraction. Matches filename only.

Workflow.title: Workflow
Workflow.description: Add the following expression here: workflow()

FilesAddedSuccessfully.title: Number of files added successfully
FilesAddedSuccessfully.description: The number of files that were successfully added to the ZIP.

FilesExcluded.title: Number of files excluded
FilesExcluded.description: The number of files that were excluded (if using the 'Exclude files regular expression' input).
